data.title: Tasty and cheap
data.text: Don't let it's appearance scare you away! Service was fast and staff was nice. This place has some yummy entrees. They give you large portions for very cheap. I got the shrimp basket, hubby and Dad in- law got fish and shrimps. The fish and shrimp are all giant! They were the biggest shrimp I have ever seen while not at fancy ultra expensive restaurant. Everyone enjoyed their entrees. I liked my red beans and rice, and my green beans were good, but a little black peppery. The guys got fries. Hush puppies were especially good (I think they were a sweet jalapeño hush puppy). The mac and cheese left a little to be desired but was improved with some salt, though still kinda bland. The place is definitely a little strangely converted but it had some cool artwork and weirdly cool planetary fans.

data.title: do not eatr the fish
data.text: they serve white fish that is basa, from vietnam, a fish that is ban from several countries, as australia, reason, it is raised in the mecong waters and is loaded with insecticides, paracites in that enviroment

data.title: You've heard of terrible
data.text: Tried twice, not sure why.  Greasy enough food to make one really sick. Their fried fish doesn't have a name or species just fried fish.  The gizzards not fit to eat.

data.title: Weekend fun
data.text: Great place to eat.....  You can tell they put tender loving care into it...... Worth the wait... They should think about serving desert

data.title: Excellent Fish and Shrimp
data.text: Fish and Shrimp were both jumbo, fresh and quite tasty. Chips were excellent as well. Only minus was that they were a little slow cleaning the tables.

data.title: Good seafood at fair price; nice sides
data.text: I have taken out from this restaurant, eaten lunch and dinner here inside, and never had a bad meal. Shrimp and catfish, both broiled and fried, very tasty. Chicken good also. Sides are excellent, with a nice variety.  Pretty basic, and somewhat dimly lit, inside. But, I have found it clean and enjoy the people that work there. Given the rather blah food offerings throughout Waco and the abundance of chain restaurants, this place deserves a much higher rating. I have not been more recently, as I'm trying to avoid fried foods, and carbs, but otherwise I would be here each month.

data.title: They really do have Jumbo shrimp!
data.text:
Move over Red Lobster! I finally ate at Sam's Southern Eatery yesterday (4/2/2016) and the food was wonderful. I had grilled shrimp along with fried okra and cole slaw. My wife had the fried shrimp with French fries and fried okra. Everything was really good. Although the place is not so pleasing to the eye, it seemed clean and the staff treated us well. We were the only people actually eating in the dining room but a lot of people came in to pick up to-go orders while we were there. Most of the tables were dirty but we finally sat at the least dirty one. I got the feeling that we had come in right after their lunch rush.
Back to the food. The grilled shrimp were truly jumbo and were fried with onions and bell peppers which were on my plate with the shrimp. Delicious! In most places the grilled vegetables would have been one of your side dishes. The fried shrimp were breaded with a very tasty tempura type of batter and were also jumbo and delicious. The fried okra were typical fried okra out of a bag but tasted good. The french fries too. The cole slaw tasted a lot like that at Long John Silvers (a good thing.) The portions were generous and we left feeling full and satisfied. 
They advertise their Jumbo Shrimp and they are not lying. They were what I call "three bite shrimp." I will definitely be returning to this restaurant and will tell everyone that I know to give it a try!

data.title: Good food
data.text: Have eaten at Sam's several times. Not a fancy restaurant but clean. Come early because it can get crowded. Lunch menu offer great value meals.

data.title: Best Fried Shrimp in WACO
data.text: Sams, while not the trendiest setting is the home to JUMB SHRIMP, no that is not misspelled that what it says on the counter! That said the Shrimp are Jumbo and very good! I have not tried much other than fried shrimp but have seen others eating burgers, fried fish, fried oysters, ect and all said they were good! Price... I would say CHEAP. Atmosphere... well better than a fish dock. Mix of clients - suits to sandals! Have been at least 10 times in the last year!   If you like fried shrimp - GO THERE!

data.title: Great Eats at Very Fair Prices
data.text: While visiting Waco we saw a brightly painted restaurant with the name on it.  We went in and it was like a fast food place as the prices were on electric lit boards behind the counter.  The prices seemed fair for the food but we decided to split a plate and got a 4 shrimp/4 fish.  The shrimp were quite large for the price and tasted GREAT.  The four pieces of fish were huge and also delightful.  We paid $9.99 for the meal and less than 2 bucks for the drinks.  We were so pleased that when my sister and her husband who were with us the first time texted two days later that they went back and did we want anything, we had them pick up the same order and it was just as good.

data.title: Tough shrimp
data.text: The food was really terrible.  A friend recommended this place and we are wondering if it was just an off day.  The food was not fresh. The shrimp was over cooked and tasted like frozen and warmed up.  Will not go back.

data.title: worth the money
data.text: Two some times three people can share one plate..diffently get your moneys worth here.Very worth the wait.

data.title: Good Southern Eatin'
data.text: This is some good eating.  You will for sure get your moneys worth here.  I have a family of 5 and we get 2 of the big plates and always end up taking food home.

data.title: Don't be put off by the exterior
data.text: Great fried chicken strips, grilled shrimp and sandwiches. A good selection of side. The meals were inexpensive and the portions were huge.

data.title: Awful
data.text: I would give it a lower score, but this is the lowest you can give. The food was greasy and undercooked. The service was not bad, but the food was.

data.title: Fish shrimp lovers delight
data.text: Servings sizes are more than you can eat.  Whatever the order for shrimp or fish, they will always put an extra piece or two on your plate.

data.title: 5 stars!!
data.text: Awesome food!!!  The fish is cooked perfect and their tartar is awesome!  Service has always been friendly.

data.title: Good southern cooking
data.text: We've eaten in the restaurant once and had take out several times.  The atmosphere is nothing to write home about, so take out is a good option.  We usually get the 4 piece fish dinner, which is available fried or grilled and they will split the cooking method for you - two each.  My husband has also had the fried shrimp dinner and pronounced it good. Sides are solid, even if the green beans are canned - they have flavor!  Mac and cheese is good, and the red beans and rice is my husband's favorite.  A single 4 piece fish dinner is plenty for 2.  The chicken wings are breaded and fried in a spicy batter - not buffalo style, if that is what you are looking for.  Sauces are great and the staff is very helpful.  I would recommend for dinner on the fly!

data.title: Best Fried Fish in town
data.text: I have never had a bad experience at Sam's.  The food is cooked when ordered so you won't get any greasy, soggy, or cold fish.  However this does mean that you have to wait a while.  The shrimp is huge so are the oysters.  The homemade tartar sauce is great.  The red beans and rice are wonderful.  The consistency is 100%.  This place doesn't look like much but is well worth the drive from anywhere in Waco.

data.title: Huge Portions, Good Food
data.text: Probably the best of Waco’s limited seafood options. The building is actually a bit of a dive, but the food makes up for it. The fried jumbo shrimp were big, crispy and golden brown. My husband had a combo that included the jumbo shrimp, plus fried catfish and fried chicken tenders, all of which were good. Both meals came with a choice of two sides and hushpuppies. We had the fries and mac & cheese, which were average. My husband loved the hushpuppies, but I thought they were just OK. The portions were huge, and each of us took home leftovers. This will definitely be our go-to place in Waco when we’re craving seafood.
